thread.title: Back-to-back U-15 singles state titles for Nagpur shuttler
thread.title_full: Back-to-back U-15 singles state titles for Nagpur shuttler - The Times of India

author: Suhas Nayse
title: Back-to-back U-15 singles state titles for Nagpur shuttler
text:
NAGPUR: Living up to his form and reputation, Rohan Gurbani justified his top billing to emerge champion in the U-15 boys singles at the Maharashtra Sub-Junior State Selection Badminton tournament which concluded at Ratnagiri on Sunday. 

The 13-year-old rallied back to overcome the stiff challenge from third seed Kedar Bhide 18-21, 21-16, 21-15 in the final which lasted for 43 minutes. 

It was the second title in a row for this talented city shuttler this season. At Parbhani on August 1, Rohan recorded a straight-game victory over unseeded Prathamesh Halankar of Pune in a one-sided final. 

Rohan, a Standard VIII student of Centre Point School, Katol Road, displayed wonderful performance against Pune's Kedar. After losing the opening game, Rohan recovered well to pocket the next two games and match. 

Rohan will now focus on the forthcoming All India Sub-Junior Ranking tournament slated to be held at Guntur.
